verses.kjv: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.
verses.ct: In the land of Uz there lived a man named Job. He was a blameless and honorable man, wholeheartedly dedicated to God and determined to avoid evil.

verses.kjv: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
verses.ct: He had 7 sons and 3 daughters.

verses.kjv: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east.
verses.ct: He owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 pairs of oxen, and 500 female donkeys, along with a huge number of servants. He was the wealthiest person in the entire eastern region.

verses.kjv: And his sons went and feasted in their houses, every one his day; and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
verses.ct: His sons would take turns hosting feasts at each other's homes on their appointed days, and they would invite their 3 sisters to come eat and drink with them.

verses.kjv: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and cursed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
verses.ct: After each round of feasting was over, Job would have them ceremonially purified. He would get up early in the morning and offer a burnt offering for each one of them, thinking, "Maybe my children have sinned and dishonored God in their hearts." Job made this his regular practice.

verses.kjv: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them.
verses.ct: One day the sons of God came to stand in the LORD's presence, and Satan showed up among them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the LORD, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
verses.ct: The LORD asked Satan, "Where have you come from?" Satan replied to the LORD, "I've been roaming all over the earth, going back and forth across it."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil?
verses.ct: The LORD said to Satan, "Have you noticed my servant Job? There is no one on earth like him — a blameless and honorable man who is wholeheartedly dedicated to God and stays away from evil."

verses.kjv: Then Satan answered the LORD, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?
verses.ct: Satan answered the LORD, "Does Job revere God for nothing?"

verses.kjv: Hast not thou made an hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
verses.ct: "Haven't you put a protective wall around him, his family, and everything he owns? You've made everything he does successful, and his wealth keeps growing throughout the land."

verses.kjv: But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will curse thee to thy face.
verses.ct: "But reach out your hand and strike everything he has, and he will curse you right to your face."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD told Satan, "Look — everything he has is under your control. Just don't lay a hand on Job himself." Then Satan left the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:
verses.ct: One day, while Job's sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine at their oldest brother's house,

verses.kjv: And there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them:
verses.ct: a messenger rushed to Job and reported, "The oxen were plowing and the donkeys were grazing nearby,

verses.kjv: And the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.ct: when the Sabeans attacked and carried them off! They killed the servants with their swords. I'm the only one who got away to tell you."

verses.kjv: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.ct: While that messenger was still talking, another one arrived and said, "Fire from God fell out of heaven and burned up the sheep and the servants — completely destroyed them! I'm the only one who got away to tell you."

verses.kjv: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made out three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have carried them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.ct: While that one was still talking, yet another messenger came and said, "The Chaldeans split into 3 raiding parties and attacked the camels and took them all! They killed the servants with their swords. I'm the only one who got away to tell you."

verses.kjv: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:
verses.ct: While that one was still talking, still another messenger arrived and said, "Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine at your oldest son's house,

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.ct: when suddenly a powerful wind came roaring in from the desert and struck all 4 corners of the house. It collapsed on the young people, and they're all dead. I'm the only one who got away to tell you."

verses.kjv: Then Job arose, and rent his mantle, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped,
verses.ct: Job stood up, tore his robe in grief, shaved his head, then dropped to the ground and worshiped.

verses.kjv: And said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither: the LORD gave, and the LORD hath taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: He said, "I came into this world with nothing, and I will leave it with nothing. The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away. May the name of the LORD be praised."

verses.kjv: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
verses.ct: Through all of this, Job did not sin or blame God for anything wrong.
